This article describes a family-focused social skills development model which has been successfully implemented in the children's mental_health field to enhance children's social interaction, impulse control, and social problem-solving skills. In this model, skill training is adaptively focused on the child, the family, or both, depending on the resources available, the individual family situation, and whether the child is receiving inpatient or outpatient services.
